alert.note: Alert for Tillamook (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued November 04 at 11:00PM PDT until November 05 at 8:17AM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Oregon and Washington... Trask River near Tillamook affecting Tillamook County. Nehalem River near Foss affecting Tillamook and Clatsop Counties. Wilson River near Tillamook affecting Tillamook County. Grays River near Rosburg affecting Wahkiakum County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Washington... Naselle River near Naselle affecting Wahkiakum and Pacific Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Wilson River near Tillamook. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...Above 14.0 feet, widespread lowland and dairy land flooding begins. Sloughs north of the city, mainly Dougherty, begin to overflow. Minor flooding begins in the business district north of Tillamook and along Hwy 101, particularly during high tide. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM PDT Friday the stage was 13.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 PM PDT Friday was 13.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 14.4 feet late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight to about 7.0 feet by Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning by 10 am PDT.
